      • cameraSettings

        public boolean cameraSettings(boolean capture_mode,
                              long exposure_time,
                              int x0,
                              int x1,
                              int y0,
                              int y1,
                              short xbin,
                              short ybin)
        Pixis Specific settings. Behaves identically to cameraSettings but includes pixis specific binning xbin, ybin.
        Parameters:
        capture_mode -
        exposure_time -
        x0 -
        x1 -
        y0 -
        y1 -
        xbin -
        ybin -
        Returns:
        TRUE if the given settings are valid.

      • stopCapture

        public boolean stopCapture(int option)
        Stops the capture sequence of the camera base on the passed option.

        Parameters:
        option - - {0) CCS_NO_CHANGE: No change - (1) CCS_HALT: Halt all CCS activity, put in idle state - (2) CCS_HALT_CLOSE_SHTR: Close the shutter, then do CCS_HALT - (3) CCS_CLEAR: Put the CCS in the continuous clearing state - (4) CCS_CLEAR_CLOSE_SHTR: Close the shutter, then do CCS_CLEAR - (5) CCS_OPEN_SHTR: Open the shutter, then do CCS_HALT - (6) CCS_CLEAR_OPEN_SHTR: Open the shutter, then to CCS_CLEAR
        Returns:

      • stopCaptureSpi

        Specified by:

      • getParamList

        public java.lang.String[] getParamList()

        Returns:
        a string array with the possible parameters

      • getCcsStatus

        public int getCcsStatus()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieve the status of the camera control subsystem (CCS)
        Returns:
        ccs_status The CCS status. One of: - (0) IDLE - (1) INITIALIZING - (2) RUNNING - (3) CONTINUOUSLY_CLEARING
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.

      • getShtrStatus

        public int getShtrStatus()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieve the status of the shutter
        Returns:
        The shutter status. One of: - (0) SHTR_FAULT: Shutter has overheated - (1) SHTR_OPENING: Shutter is opening - (2) SHTR_OPEN: Shutter is open - (3) SHTR_CLOSING: Shutter is closing - (4) SHTR_CLOSED: Shutter is closed - (5) SHTR_UNKNOWN: The system cannot determine the shutter state
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.

      • shtrOpenNever

        public boolean shtrOpenNever()
        Close the shutter, and do not open it during exposures. Equivalent to setting the PARAM_SHTR_OPEN_MODE parameter to OPEN_NEVER
        Returns:
        1 on success, 0 on failure

      • shtrOpenNormal

        public boolean shtrOpenNormal()
        Open the shutter during exposures. Equivalent to setting the PARAM_SHTR_OPEN_MODE parameter to OPEN_PRE_EXPOSURE

        Returns:
        1 on success, 0 on failure

               throws java.io.IOException

        Returns:
        the maximum gain setting (camera dependent; may be as high as 16)
        Throws:

        public short getSpeedMode()

        the table index

      • setSpeedMode

        public boolean setSpeedMode(short speed)
        Set the CCD readout speed from a table of available choices.
        Parameters:
        speed - the table index
        Returns:
        1 on success, 0 on failure

      • getReadoutPort

        public short getReadoutPort()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Get the CCD readout port Possible readout port values (the available ports are camera-specific; use ccd_get_readout_port_entries to determine the number of available ports):
        • READOUT_PORT_MULT_GAIN = 0
        • READOUT_PORT_NORMAL = 1
        • READOUT_PORT_LOW_NOISE = 2
        • READOUT_PORT_HIGH_CAP = 3
        Returns:
        the port number
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.

      • setReadoutPort

        public boolean setReadoutPort(short port)
        Set the CCD readout port choice NOTE: The gain, speed, and bit depth may be altered as a result of setting this parameter. You should maintain a list of available readout ports and associated settings, and set all of them after calling this function.
        Parameters:
        port - the readout port index
        Returns:
        1 on success, 0 on failure

      • getRetries

        public int getRetries()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Get the maximum number of command retries. This should normally not be changed since it "is matched to the communications link, hardware platform, and operating system" [PVCAM 2.6 Manual, p. 36]
        Returns:
        the maximum number of retries
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.

      • setRetries

        public boolean setRetries(int retries)
        Set the maximum number of command retries. This should normally not be changed since it "is matched to the communications link, hardware platform, and operating system" [PVCAM 2.6 Manual, p. 36]
        Parameters:
        retries - the maximum number of retries
        Returns:
        1 on success, 0 on failure

      • getTimeout

        public int getTimeout()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Get the maximum time to wait for acknowledgement. This should normally not be changed since it "is matched to the communications link, hardware platform, and operating system" [PVCAM 2.6 Manual, p. 36]
        Returns:
        the timeout setting in milliseconds
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.

      • setTimeout

        public boolean setTimeout(int mSec)
        Set the maximum time to wait for acknowledgement. This should normally not be changed since it "is matched to the communications link, hardware platform, and operating system" [PVCAM 2.6 Manual, p. 36]
        Parameters:
        mSec - the timeout setting in milliseconds
        Returns:
        1 on success, 0 on failure

      • getFrameCapable

        public int getFrameCapable()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Determine whether this camera can run in frame transfer mode (set through PARAM_PMODE)

        Returns:
        1 if the camera is frame capable, 0 if not
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.
